info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 10:27PM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY NIGHT TO 3 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below to 30 below zero. * WHERE...Southern Herkimer County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 1 AM EST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight Monday night to 3 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult due to lake effect snow and localized whiteout conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow totals will be north of the Thruway. The coldest wind chills will occur late Monday night into Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
